description: Learned borrowing from Late Latin dēteriorātus, past participle of Late Latin dēteriorō, derivative of Latin dēterior (“worse”).

verbs.description: deteriorate (third-person singular simple present deteriorates, present participle deteriorating, simple past and past participle deteriorated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To make worse; to make inferior in quality or value; to impair.
(intransitive) To grow worse; to be impaired in quality; to degenerate.
